intro: Lobelia eryliae subsp. luzonica, commonly known as Luzon lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as montane forests and stream banks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
